title: US average of daily Covid-19 cases hits highest level since February
description: The US is averaging more than 100,000 new daily Covid-19 cases each day, the highest in nearly six months, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

title: Team USA finishes top of the medal table for third consecutive Olympic Games
Taliban seizes Kunduz, first major Afghan city to fall in vacuum left by US troop withdrawal
description: The Taliban has seized control of Kunduz in northern Afghanistan, local officials told CNN on Sunday. It is the first major city to fall to the insurgent group since they began their offensive in May, and marks a big blow to the Afghan government.

title: We know Donald Trump tried to overturn the election. Here's what we didn't know
description: CNN's Brian Stelter and John Avlon say it's important for the media to continue covering former President Donald Trump's last days in office because the full picture of Trump's "pathetic" coup attempt to overthrow democracy is just now starting to emerge.

title: Paul Whelan released from solitary confinement in Russian prison
description: Paul Whelan, a US citizen detained in Russia, has been released from solitary confinement in his Mordovian penal colony in the country, according to Russian state news agency TASS.

title: Senate moves toward final vote on massive $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure package
description: The Senate will reconvene on Sunday at noon to resume consideration of the massive $1.2 trillion bipartisan infrastructure package.

title: These 5 figures show how bad the US Covid-19 surge is
description: As the rate of Covid-19 vaccinations climbed and new infection numbers plummeted in spring, many Americans thought they were in for a carefree summer.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez does not rule out 2022 challenge to Chuck Schumer
description: New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez does not know what her political future holds -- and that includes whether she might challenge Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer in a 2022 primary.

title: The rule of law is pushing back against Trump's big lie
description: For all those alarmed by the assaults on democracy in the 2020 election cycle and its aftermath, it will come as a great relief that the rule of law is pushing back.

title: Republican disagrees with Ron DeSantis' handling of Covid-19
description: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-LA) says that he disagrees with Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' taking a top down approach in handling the Covid-19 pandemic, saying that decisions on mask mandates and restrictions should be made at the local level.

title: Lionel Messi says PSG move is a 'possibility' as he bids tearful farewell to Barcelona
description: As he bid a tearful farewell to Barcelona on Sunday, football superstar Lionel Messi said a move to Paris Saint-Germain was "a possibility."

title: FBI selects first Black woman to join a bureau SWAT team: 'She has what it takes'
description: An FBI agent in Puerto Rico is believed to be the first Black woman to be selected to train for any of the bureau's SWAT teams.

title: Bobby Bowden, legendary Florida State University football coach, dies at 91
description: Bobby Bowden, the famed college football coach who led Florida State University for over 30 years and transformed the Tallahassee team into a powerhouse, died Sunday, the school said in a statement. He was 91.

title: The risky loophole Chinese companies have been using for years
description: When investors purchase a stock, what they're doing is buying a percentage of the company. Right?

title: A Black realtor was showing a home to a Black father and son. They were handcuffed by Michigan police
description: A Black realtor was showing a house to a Black man and his 15-year-old son in a Michigan suburb last week when they looked outside and saw police officers surrounding the property with their guns drawn.

title: Denver experienced the worst air quality of any major city in the world due to smoke from western wildfires
description: Denver experienced the worst air quality of any city in the world for several hours Saturday as heavy smoke from raging western wildfires polluted the city.

title: The world is on the brink of 'catastrophe,' leader of next UN climate talks warns
description: Failure to act now on climate change will result in "catastrophic" consequences for the world, the leader of the United Nation's next climate talks has warned.

title: More than 400 universities are requiring Covid-19 vaccines. But the threat of fake vaccination cards worries some students and experts
description: Students at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill can voluntarily share their Covid-19 vaccine status with administration, but those who show up on campus unvaccinated or choose not to disclose their vaccination status will have to get tested for coronavirus weekly.

title: The Sierra Nevada red fox is now protected and listed as an endangered species
description: The Sierra Nevada red fox, a rare California species whose population is dramatically dwindling, has been listed as endangered.

title: Meet Truffles, the special kitty who wears glasses to help kids feel better about wearing theirs
description: Nearly four years ago, Danielle Crull rescued a stray kitten from a forest in Pennsylvania.

title: What happens to Japan's Olympics venues after the Games?
description: There's nothing like watching the Olympics on TV to give you a major case of wanderlust.

title: Covid-19 booster shots for the rich world could make the pandemic worse, experts warn
description: • 'You've lost your minds': Governor fires back at anti-vaxxers

title: Beheading of a diplomat's daughter shows how badly Pakistan is failing its women
Fast track and super shoes: Athletes enter 'deal with devil'
description: A fast track and new developments in running shoe design have seen a number of records broken at the Tokyo Olympics, but a leading sports scientist has warned athletes that they could be entering into a "Faustian bargain."
